question: The Sultan of Delhi sultanate, Bahlol Lodhi was succeeded by whom?
explanation: The founder of Lodhi dynasty, Sultan Bahlol Lodhi was succeeded by his son Nizam Khan who ascended the throne in 1489 AD as Sikandar Lodhi. In 1506 AD, he shifted his capital form Delhi to Agra. He was a poet of the Persian language and prepared a diwan of 9000 verses.
